1353322212.content:
Felicia mewled as she sat in the doctor's office. It had been three weeks since she had sex with Jon, and she had been feeling off-kilter ever since. She'd been putting on weight, getting hungry all the time, getting sick in the mornings, gaining a prominent belly as well as a larger, jigglier butt. Worried, she had made an appointment with the doctor. She was snacking on banana chips, fidgeting nervously, rubbing her belly unconsciously.

The doctor, a handsome, bearded man who was one of the few physicians who weren't afraid of how inhuman she was, came out, looking rather stunned. He came out and sat across from Felicia, staring into her eyes. "Tell me..." he asked. "How much do you make in a year with your albums?"

Felicia blinked. "What does my singing career have to do with anything?" she asked.

"Just... indulge me," the Doctor said.

Felicia frowned. "Well, not counting my charity work..." She listed the number. Famous kitty was famous. Rich kitty was rich.

The doctor did some math in his head. "Good, good, you can afford them," he said.

"Afford who?!" Felicia said, getting nervous.

"You're pregnant," the doctor said. "With a metric fuckton of babies. That's why you're growing fatter so fast."

Felicia blinked. She loved the idea of being pregnant, and had secretly been hoping for it. But this made her nervous. "...How many is in a fuckton?"

The doctor told her. Felicia promptly fainted.

13533223333333312.content:
Lara Croft could admit that, from time to time, her curiosity got her into trouble. As an adventurer/explorer/archaeologist with enough money to fund her lifestyle, she tended to go where her whims could take her. Sometimes she used her good looks to help grease the wheels of her clients, her toned, athletic body sporting ample curves, her large breasts, thick legs, and wide booty always a point of attraction for heterosexual men. (And many lesbians.) Her long brown hair (usually kept in a ponytail) and British accent. Sometimes, she had to rely on her incredible agility and accuracy to get her through a problem. Other times, her brilliant, creative mind got her out of trouble.

None of that was going to help her this time.

The moment she had entered the temple, hidden deep within the Egyptian desert, the door had slammed shut, sealing with what Lara recognized with magic. Pulling out a glowstick, she began to read the hieroglyphics on the walls. They were of an ancient dialect, and she had to struggle to remember what they meant, but there were also pictures there that helped.

The temple was actually actually Greek, dedicated to the ancient mother of monsters, Echidna. Her children were all trapped in this temple, which bore a curse. Any woman who entered must have the baby of every monster who's room she enters before the temple gates on the other side of the temple will open. From what she could tell, each pregnancy would progress rapidly, as would the birth.

Lara grimaced. "Not exactly the way I wanted to become a mom," she muttered. She analyzed everything in the entrance hallway, and discovered there was no way out. "...Hopefully this won't end in me getting raped in every room." Reluctantly, she headed towards the end of the hall. She found three doors in front of her, each with a different shape on them. One with a wolf's head, one with a snake's head, and one with a giant eyeball.
